explanation: the act of making someone seem less important or less deserving of respect
sentence: Slaves were subject to a life of degradation and abasement.
sentence_gap: Slaves were subject to a life of degradation and _________.

explanation: formal; mysterious and known only by a few people
sentence: He was the only person who understood all the arcane details of the agreement.

explanation: clever and skilful, especially in getting what you want
sentence: He has shown himself to be an artful politician.
sentence_gap: He has shown himself to be an ______ politician.

explanation: to close and open the eyes quickly, once or several times
sentence: He stared at us without blinking.
sentence_gap: He stared at us without ________.

explanation: a mark that is not regular in shape, for example on a person's skin
sentence: Her face was covered in purple blotches.
sentence_gap: Her face was covered in purple ________.

explanation: to think a lot about something that makes you annoyed, anxious, or upset
sentence: You're not still brooding over what he said, are you?
sentence_gap: You're not still ________ over what he said, are you?

explanation: (a plant with) a small flower with a sweet smell, usually white, pink, or red in color
sentence: He was wearing a carnation in his buttonhole.
sentence_gap: He was wearing a _________ in his buttonhole.

explanation: a long, loose, usually black piece of clothing worn especially by priests
sentence: He is rarely seen without a thick beard, and performs in an all black cassock.
sentence_gap: He is rarely seen without a thick beard, and performs in an all black _______.

explanation: sticky and slightly wet in an unpleasant way
sentence: My hands felt all clammy.
sentence_gap: My hands felt all ______.

explanation: the most important or exciting point in a story or situation, especially when this happens near the end
sentence: The election campaign reaches its climax next week.
sentence_gap: The election campaign reaches its ______ next week.

explanation: formal; a formal conversation
sentence: In the cave the saint held his famous colloquy with the devil, in which Satan was worsted and contemptuously dismissed.
sentence_gap: In the cave the saint held his famous ________ with the devil, in which Satan was worsted and contemptuously dismissed.

explanation: to confuse and very much surprise someone, so that they are unable to explain or deal with a situation
sentence: The singer confounded her critics with a remarkable follow-up album.
sentence_gap: The singer __________ her critics with a remarkable follow-up album.

sentence: A mixed forest of deciduous and conifer trees formed a dense covering of mottled greens.
sentence_gap: A mixed forest of deciduous and _______ trees formed a dense covering of mottled greens.

explanation: a curved part of a coast that partly surrounds an area of water
sentence: The coastline has steep cliffs, gigantic sea caves, coves, and sandy beaches.
sentence_gap: The coastline has steep cliffs, gigantic sea caves, _____, and sandy beaches.

explanation: formal; to criticize something as bad, without value, or unnecessary
sentence: Lawyers decried the imprisonment of several journalists.
sentence_gap: Lawyers _______ the imprisonment of several journalists.

explanation: formal; an intentional act, especially a very bad or very good one
sentence: It seems to me that a lot of evil deeds are done in the name of religion.
sentence_gap: It seems to me that a lot of evil _____ are done in the name of religion.

explanation: unable to think or act clearly because you are extremely worried, angry, or excited by something
sentence: She was nearly demented with worry when her son didn't come home.
sentence_gap: She was nearly ________ with worry when her son didn't come home.

explanation: formal; unkind and showing that you think someone or something is ridiculous
sentence: She gave a short, derisive laugh.
sentence_gap: She gave a short, ________ laugh.

explanation: making someone feel uncertain and uncomfortable or worried
sentence: His message is deeply disconcerting for anyone who values democracy.
sentence_gap: His message is deeply _____________ for anyone who values democracy.

explanation: formal; the state of not agreeing or sharing opinions
sentence: The plan to build the highway created discord in our community.
sentence_gap: The plan to build the highway created _______ in our community.

explanation: formal; to become involved with or support an activity or opinion
sentence: They espoused the notion of equal opportunity for all in education.
sentence_gap: They ________ the notion of equal opportunity for all in education.

explanation: formal; in a way that is clear
sentence: I expressly told you to be home by midnight.
sentence_gap: I _________ told you to be home by midnight.

explanation: an unpleasant or ugly sight in a public place
sentence: They think the new library building is an eyesore.
sentence_gap: They think the new library building is an _______.

explanation: (especially of arms and legs) to move energetically in an uncontrolled way
sentence: A wasp came towards us and Howard started flailing his arms around.
sentence_gap: A wasp came towards us and Howard started ________ his arms around.

explanation: (a piece of) shiny grey or black stone that is like glass; stone or metal used in a musket to make it fire or in a cigarette lighter to produce a flame
sentence: Scraping the striker down the flint generates a spark three times as hot as a standard match to ignite easily any dry tinder material.
sentence_gap: Scraping the striker down the _____ generates a spark three times as hot as a standard match to ignite easily any dry tinder material.

explanation: covered with a thin layer of gold or a substance that looks like gold
sentence: The gilded dome of the cathedral rises above the city.
sentence_gap: The ______ dome of the cathedral rises above the city.

explanation: (of speakers and speech) using words in an easy and smooth way but without much thought, and usually not sincere
sentence: No one was convinced by his glib explanations.
sentence_gap: No one was convinced by his ____ explanations.

explanation: an extremely strong feeling of dislike
sentence: What is very clear in these letters is Clark's passionate hatred of his father.
sentence_gap: What is very clear in these letters is Clark's passionate ______ of his father.

explanation: very determined to do what you want without listening to others
sentence: She was a headstrong child, always getting into trouble.
sentence_gap: She was a __________ child, always getting into trouble.

explanation: enthusiastically, energetically, and often loudly
sentence: She laughed heartily at the joke.
sentence_gap: She laughed ________ at the joke.

explanation: a valuable object that has been given by older members of a family to younger members of the same family over many years
sentence: This ring is a family heirloom.
sentence_gap: This ring is a family ________.

explanation: having fixed opinions and ways of doing things and not willing to change or be influenced, especially by new or modern ideas
sentence: She wanted a life that was less hidebound by rules and conventions.
sentence_gap: She wanted a life that was less _________ by rules and conventions.

explanation: formal; impossible to doubt because of being obviously true
sentence: Her logic is utterly incontrovertible.
sentence_gap: Her logic is utterly ________________.

explanation: a formal statement of accusing someone
sentence: The charges on the indictment include murder and attempted murder.
sentence_gap: The charges on the __________ include murder and attempted murder.

explanation: (the making of) a remark or remarks that suggest something sexual or something unpleasant but do not refer to it directly
sentence: There's always an element of sexual innuendo in our conversations.
sentence_gap: There's always an element of sexual ________ in our conversations.

explanation: to put things that are not similar next to each other
sentence: The exhibition juxtaposes Picasso's early drawings with some of his later works.
sentence_gap: The exhibition __________ Picasso's early drawings with some of his later works.

explanation: taking a lot of time and effort
sentence: Checking all the information will be slow and laborious.
sentence_gap: Checking all the information will be slow and _________.

explanation: informal; UK; toilet
sentence: I'll just go to the loo.
sentence_gap: I'll just go to the ___.

explanation: a liquid that you put on your skin in order to protect it, improve its condition, or make it smell pleasant
sentence: She smeared sun tan lotion all over herself.
sentence_gap: She smeared sun tan ______ all over herself.

explanation: a long, wide hole that is dug all the way around a place such as a castle and usually filled with water, to make it more difficult to attack
sentence: The seven-metre-high wall that enclosed the dockyards was surrounded by a deep and wide moat.
sentence_gap: The seven-metre-high wall that enclosed the dockyards was surrounded by a deep and wide ____.

explanation: a building in which monks live and worship
sentence: Women are not allowed to enter the monastery for historical reasons.
sentence_gap: Women are not allowed to enter the _________ for historical reasons.

explanation: the state of being completely forgotten
sentence: He was another minor poet who was consigned to oblivion.
sentence_gap: He was another minor poet who was consigned to ________.

explanation: a sudden forceful expression of emotion, especially anger
sentence: Her comments provoked an outburst of anger from the boss.
sentence_gap: Her comments provoked an ________ of anger from the boss.

explanation: a flat piece of glass, used in a window or door
sentence: It's a huge window made from a single pane of glass.
sentence_gap: It's a huge window made from a single ____ of glass.

explanation: influenced by the fact that you personally prefer or approve of something, so that you do not judge fairly
sentence: The reporting in the papers is entirely partial and makes no attempt to be objective.
sentence_gap: The reporting in the papers is entirely _______ and makes no attempt to be objective.

explanation: a short piece of writing or music that is part of a larger piece of work
sentence: Several passages from the book were printed in a national newspaper before it was published.
sentence_gap: Several ________ from the book were printed in a national newspaper before it was published.

explanation: to secretly look at something for a short time, usually through a hole
sentence: We caught her peeping through the keyhole.
sentence_gap: We caught her _______ through the keyhole.

explanation: thinking deeply about something, especially because you are sad or worried
sentence: She became withdrawn and pensive, hardly speaking to anyone.
sentence_gap: She became withdrawn and _______, hardly speaking to anyone.

explanation: an enclosed area where pigs are kept
sentence: Your bedroom is a pigpen!
sentence_gap: Your bedroom is a ______!

explanation: the smallest finger of the hand

translated: błagać, prosić, przyznawać się do winy
explanation: to make an urgent, emotional statement or request for something
sentence: He was on his knees, pleading for mercy.

sentence: Humanitarian aid such as cans of oil were resold by war profiteers.

explanation: formal disapproving; using too many words and therefore boring or difficult to read or listen to

explanation: preventing disease
sentence: Some dentists are convinced that the addition of fluoride in water is ineffective as a prophylactic treatment.

explanation: to shake slightly, often because of strong emotion
sentence: Lennie's bottom lip quivered and tears started in his eyes.

explanation: formal; to live, have your home, or stay in a place
sentence: The family now resides in southern France.

explanation: a person who leads others in crime or in causing trouble
sentence: The ringleaders of the plot were arrested and punished.

explanation: approving; having confidence in your own abilities
sentence: The interview showed her as a self-assured and mature student.

explanation: to get out of bed and walk around while you are sleeping
sentence: I sleepwalked when I was a child.

explanation: informal; an amount of drink, especially strong alcoholic drink, that you can swallow at one time
sentence: I had a slug of vodka to give me courage.

explanation: snow that is lying on the ground and has started to melt
sentence: The city’s streets were covered with dirty, gray slush.

explanation: formal; the state of being sober

sentence_gap: The police said his car had been weaving all over the road, so they pulled him over and gave him a ________ test.

explanation: (approving) (of a room or building) large and with plenty of space for people to move around in
sentence: The hotel rooms are spacious and comfortable.
sentence_gap: The hotel rooms are ________ and comfortable.

explanation: literary or old-fashioned; a man who wants to marry a particular woman
sentence: It's the story of a young woman who can't make up her mind which of her many suitors she should marry.
sentence_gap: It's the story of a young woman who can't make up her mind which of her many _______ she should marry.

explanation: to walk with difficulty in a way that looks as if you are about to fall
sentence: She tottered unsteadily down the stairs in her high-heeled shoes.
sentence_gap: She ________ unsteadily down the stairs in her high-heeled shoes.

explanation: a serious infectious disease that can attack many parts of a person's body, especially their lungs
sentence: Moreover, infectious diseases, such as tuberculosis, affect the size of the labour force and the productive capacity of the economy.
sentence_gap: Moreover, infectious diseases, such as ____________, affect the size of the labour force and the productive capacity of the economy.

explanation: formal; to say something or to make a sound with your voice
sentence: She sat through the whole meeting without uttering a word.
sentence_gap: She sat through the whole meeting without ________ a word.

explanation: formal; the quality of being true, honest, or accurate
sentence: Doubts were cast on the veracity of her alibi.
sentence_gap: Doubts were cast on the ________ of her alibi.

explanation: formal; to destroy or damage something
sentence: He said that American military power should never again be vitiated by political concerns.
sentence_gap: He said that American military power should never again be ________ by political concerns.

explanation: (especially of a tail or finger) to move from side to side or up and down, especially quickly and repeatedly, or to cause this to happen
